frame.name: Deny_permission
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, an <fen>Authority</fen> orders a <fen>Protagonist</fen> not to engage in an <fen>Action</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Authority">The police officer</fex> <t>forbid</t> <fex name="Protagonist">me</fex> <fex name="Action">from turning around</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Authority
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Authority</fen> orders the <fen>Protagonist</fen> to not engage in a particular <fen>Action</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen> wants to engage in an <fen>Action</fen>, but is ordered not to by the <fen>Authority</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Action</fen> is what the <fen>Protagonist</fen> seeks to do, but is ordered not to.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the denying of permission occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the denial of permission occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> is what the <fen>Authority</fen> hopes to accomplish by denying permission.</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition:
<def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.
First, it applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness. The notion of appraisal requires a factive portrayal of the event. The second subgroup consists of any descriptions of the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames. The state of affairs reported by the target is understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier. What that role is depends only on the predicate heading the modifier phrase.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: prohibit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: formally forbid by law, rule, etc.

lexUnit.name: outlaw.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make illegal to do something.
